T - : the concrete type for the measure value
public class InstantMeasure<T> extends DailyMeasure<T>
Class that represents measures with date and time

  • Constructor Details

    • InstantMeasure

      public InstantMeasure(Measure<T> measure, LocalDate date, LocalTime time)

    • InstantMeasure

      public InstantMeasure(T value, String unit, long epochSeconds)
      Parameters:
      value - : the value of the measure, which is of the non-primitive type T
      unit - : a string containing the unit of measure (kg, degrees, metres, etc.)
      epochSeconds - : second passed from 01-01-1970 (EPOCH)

    • InstantMeasure

      public InstantMeasure(T value, long epochSeconds)

    • InstantMeasure

      public InstantMeasure(T value, String unit, String stringDate, String dateFormat, String stringTime) throws InvalidFormatterException, DateTimeParseException
      Parameters:
      value - : the value of the measure, which is of the non-primitive type T
      unit - : a string containing the unit of measure (kg, degrees, metres, etc.)
      stringDate - : the date of the measure, following the date format specified in dateFormat
      dateFormat - : format of stringDate. It must follow DateTimeFormatter's pattern conventions (refer to Oracle's documentation on DateTimeFormatter)
      timeString - : the hour of the measure. It must follow the pattern HH:mm
      Throws:
      InvalidFormatterException - thrown if dateFormat isn't a valid pattern
      DateTimeParseException - thrown if stringDate cannot be parsed using dateFormat 's pattern or if stringTime cannot be parsed using the pattern HH:mm

    • InstantMeasure

      public InstantMeasure(T value, String stringDate, String dateFormat, String timeString) throws InvalidFormatterException, DateTimeParseException
      Throws:
      InvalidFormatterException
      DateTimeParseException

    • toString

      public String toString(String dateFrormat) throws InvalidFormatterException
      Overrides:
      toString in class DailyMeasure<T>
      Parameters:
      dateFormat - : date formatter's pattern. It must follow DateTimeFormatter's pattern conventions (refer to Oracle's documentation on DateTimeFormatter)
      Returns:
      a string representation of the InstantMeasure object, whit dateFormat as personalized date pattern
      Throws:
      InvalidFormatterException - thrown if dateFormat isn't a valid pattern

    • toString
